faqs.question: Does Saveetha Amaravati University offer a Master’s degree programme too?
faqs.answer: Ans.Saveetha Amaravati University provides undergraduate/ Bachelor’s courses in subjects like Bachelor of Science, Bachelor of Physiotherapy, and Bachelor of occupational therapy. The University does not provide any Master's Course.

faqs.question: Ques.Which Government documents are required at the time of admission at Saveetha Amaravati University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Original document with three photocopies of Mark list of 10+2, Certificate from the institution last studied, Transfer Certificate, Date of Birth Proof, 8 passport size and 6 stamp size photographs, (If any, Foreign students) Nationality Certificate, Passport and Visa Copy are required.

faqs.question: What does it mean by Job-oriented training at Saveetha Amaravati University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Saveetha Amaravati University provides Orientation that provides basic information on job nature and trains the students so that they can face any type of jobs with full confidence and can do best in it. This all is simply done through lectures, interactive sessions, soft skill development, workshops etc. This boost the confidence of the students for facing interviews.

faqs.question: How one can contact Saveetha Amaravati University?
faqs.answer: Ans.One can contact the University at +91-8074247357 or can mail atadmissions@saveethaamaravati.university. One can also visit the campus at the address given on the official website for face to face discussion related to any type of query or admissions.

faqs.question: What is the fee process at Saveetha Amaravati University?
faqs.answer: Ans.A candidate who gets selected needs to pay tuition fee, admission fee, university registration fee, eligibility fee, caution deposit, material and kits fee during counselling time and then in may every year. Fees will not get refunded once paid.

faqs.question: What is the timing at Saveetha Amaravati University?
faqs.answer: Ans.The timing of the University is in the morning hours from 8.30 am-4.30 am. It's important for all the students to visit the campus and seated in a classroom daily by 8.20 am.
